intro: Anthyllis vulneraria proles valesiaca, commonly known as the Valesiaca Scotch bonnet, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches a height of about 10–20 centimeters. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in dense spikes, which bloom in early spring. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval to lance-shaped leaflets. This species is native to the western Mediterranean region and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
